grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 鉢【ハチ】bowl, pot, basin, flowerpot, crown, brainpan
衣鉢【イハツ】mysteries of one's master's art, robes and a bowl (monk's key possessions auctioned off at his funeral), transmission of the dharma from master to disciple (in Zen)
托鉢【タクハツ】monk's "begging", religious mendicancy, asking for alms, going with one's bowl to the meditation hall at mealtime (in a Zen temple)
衣鉢【イハツ】mysteries of one's master's art, robes and a bowl (monk's key possessions auctioned off at his funeral), transmission of the dharma from master to disciple (in Zen)
